comment: Lecture class where she just reads off the PowerPoint she already posts to d2l and barely gives any additional input, dislike how class attendance is mandatory from a teacher who gives the same input as a highschooler giving their history presentation.

not too much to say the course schedule went smooth, there are video lessons to accompany the reading if thats easier for some. final replaced lowest test grade. there are also a few oppurtunities to get extra credit. She is easy to communicate with and discuss grades

Her online class is decent, there is online homework & a quiz every week. Quiz answers are based on the HW. 2 discussion posts + 1 for extra cred/replacement grade. There are 4 exams + a final. All lockdown browser w/camera. Final exam grade can also replace lowest exam grade. She drops a few things when calculating the grades.

She is nice and passionate about biology, but she talks A LOT. The labs were easy and there weren't any tests, just pre and post lab quizzes. The only problem with this professor is that you typically will have to stay a little later then the end of class because of how much she talks at the beginning of class.

Overall, the class itself is passable. However, the teacher is very condescending towards students and the grading criteria is never clear. She assigns lots of group quizzes, independent quizzes, homework, etc. If you don't mind group work or receiving weird/rude feedback, then this is the class for you! 2/10 overall for attitude, grading & lecture

Easy class but the trade off is her condescending attitude and weird passive aggressive tone dont get me wrong the class is easy but half way through the semester i had to do an essay about myself which has nothing to do with biology and in another assignment talk about social issues ?? Weird teacher weird class

She is incredibly easy, her exams are asynch but are lockdown browser (no webcam). She forces you to work in groups which can be hard if you don't have a hardworking group. There are resources online to help with homework and "prepare" for the (cumulative) exams (wink-wink). She gives two attempts for each exam and does not have a final.

This class gave me such a hard time, She assigns lots of group work, quizzes every week, and you might have to do a lot of writting too which dosen't make any sense since its Lab. The extra credit she gives only adds a few points to your grade. Her Lab exam is also hard and she is also really tough at grading. Don't take her!!

I'm used to heavy workloads because of my major; she assigns a LOT of work for a entry-level bio class. Expect homework with over 20 questions, group work usually twice a week, an essay unrelated to biology, a group final project, and a quiz every week. If this isn't a major class beware of the workload on top of classes within another major.

So many group assignments. If you are taking this professor then find the smartest people in the class and try and form groups with them because you are in the same groups the whole semester and you will be doing 1-2 group assignments every single week and a big group assignment at the end of the semester.
All the assignments are group-based, and she provides feedback for every assignment. Very kind professor, definitely take her!
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Every single one of her projects is a group assignment. If you end up getting a bad group you are stuck with that group for the entirety of the semester because makes groups. There are quizzes almost every week on top of the group projects that are simply nothing but busy work. do not take if you're only taking biology for credit. Way too much work

REALLY DOES CARE. she puts you in groups at the beginning of the semester. lectures during class for the first 30 minutes then you go your group assignment. but you have to use the online  textbook or her lecture slides or she WILL mark it incorrect. No test or exams. just quizzes that you can at home no lockdown browser.

SO MUCH GROUP WORK. The assignments listed on the syllabus are not the only assignments. You have to do group videos every week and group powerpoint. You also do not get to select your group so you may get stuck with people who do not pull their weight. If you're looking for something easy, this is not the course for you.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Her personalities are amazing. She understand  all her students. The problem in the class was with the group stuff. I like working alone because even so I  can rate my team, its a bit fish to say oo yeah I did more bla bla and have to judge someones learning skills and its very unconformable to go to class to see that person for semester.

We worked in groups (not that bad) and did weekly ppt's on whatever unit we were on. She records lectures and made it available to attend class via zoom. No final just 7 (?) virtual super quizzes. I have a feeling that she may not continue this virtual quiz format due to cheating but generally an okay prof. Apply yourself, submit on time, & ur good
Accidentally rated her a 4 for difficulty, but she's absolutely a 'free A' teacher.
Fair grader and prepares you well for each lab. Do not be afraid to ask questions, she is more than happy to help inside and outside of class.

Prof. Harrison is very organized and clear with her grading. There should be no reason someone should have difficulty with this class plus 85% of the answers are online. Just a completion class, so I would recommend non-bio majors to take it. If you are a bio major, I probably would take someone else to actually learn the material.

Dr. Harrison is a great teacher she knows what shes talking about BUT she assigns a lot of work, things that aren't even biology related cause she "wants to get to know you". Just do the assignments on time and study and this class is an easy A. If you want a simple workload this is not the class cause she assigns ALOT of work and papers.

This is the largest course load I have ever had and this is supposed to be an intro course. Every week there is a study module, homework, learning catalytics, quiz or test, multiple group power points, and more due. It was an easy class, but the work was not worth it. I hated this class and this professor claims to be understanding but she is not.

Most annoying class i ever took. class out of 1000pts not hard to complete, everything on quizlet but damn she strict. will report if she catches you, so beware of who you send answers to. Also had her for lab and doesn't allow you to have the same thing as ur partner. Wish i didn't take this class, rather take another math class than this.

If you enjoy taking a test weekly and doing 3 hours of homework every weekend than shes your teacher! Enjoy the hoards of homework and tests she provides that are due on non class days! Be amazed at how much of class is answering (accuracy graded) review questions she didnt fully cover, and enjoy the 7 tests & 2 projects in her one credit hour lab!

Professor Harrison was an amazing Prof! Our grades were based on a point system (up to 1000pts). We do have a lot of group work so make sure you find a good group! 8 quizzes, 7 super quizzes (lowest grade gets dropped) records all lectures, has both in-person and online lectures. Super understanding and cares a lot about her students. Take her!

Lots of group powerpoints, but they are done at the end of class. Online homework due every week, but you can use quizlet on practically every question. Very caring and friendly, and generally an easy class as long as you keep up with the assignments.

She's a really nice professor. Half of this class is group work and your group is assigned at the beginning of the semester. Attending class in person or online is important because she does learning catalytics during class which is just questions that you have to answer in real-time. No tests, but quizzes instead with 2 tries. Not hard to get an A

Dr. Harrison is a great Biology professor. Honestly, her class structure made it hard to be motivated to learn the material fully as each of our tests "superquizzes" had two attempts. Overall, I enjoyed taking her class and found it to be a relatively easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Plan on spending 25% of the course learning about things that have nothing to do with biology. This includes random studies you have no choice but to participate in, COVID-19 lecture, and other random things. Another 25% will be doing Learning Catalytics questions during class. 25% doing group work, which is just filling out powerpoint questions.
She made the class so easy and fun. Get on her good side and stay on top of work, and you'll pass no problem.
Best science professor I've had at KSU so far! she's very caring, gives you a holistic idea of the subject.

Dr. Harrison is one of the more respectable profs I've had as a college student. You can tell that she cares about her students even in a lecture class with countless amounts of students. The content is mainly Pearson online textbook assignments with some group work and quizzes. She doesn't believe in tests and instead has "Super-Quizzes"

She is awesome! best science professor I've ever taken. her lectures are super helpful and quizzes will be based of those slides. HW done individually & in a group. Group project at the end of the semester, pretty interesting. Must attend class for credit.

Took her environment class and shes amazing! Not a fan of science but she made it interesting. No test but there are quizzez on lockdown (no camera). Work heavy but not difficult at all! You work in groups but no worries if they dont do their part you wont be penalized. She will just grade your portion!

Dr. Harrison is good if you want a moderately easy A. Her work isnt too difficult but it is labor intensive and usually is done in groups. You get put in groups for the semester and she wont let you change, even if your group does none of the work. Never take her, she has no soul.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Take her!!! You will not regret it. She is the most caring and funny professor you will ever have and she gives super good lectures. You have to study and put time in outside of class but it's biology so there is lots of memorization. She really knows what she is doing and made biology enjoyable. Love her!
She was a good professor. She gives a lot of work either group work, Pearson, or personal hw about yourself, but it is manageable. I would take again

Pretty alright at most. Major opportunities for extra credit. Workload is decent along the surface for both her lecture & lab course. She is kind and can be understanding given certain circumstances. Textbook can be found online & purchased (I think). Overall though if you reciprocate the work ethic, you'll end up with a decent grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Harrison is very passive aggressive and swears way too much. Requires way too much work compared to my upper level classes. Group work is a huge part of your grade even though its virtual! Spends most the class talking about nothing and we basically have to teach ourself. Not recommend if you dont like structure and passive aggressive people!

Professor Harrison was one of the most caring and accommodating professors/teachers Ive ever encountered. I had a family matter that caused me to basically fail the course however Professor Harrison REACHED OUT TO ME to see how she could help me pass the class. She is an absolutely amazing and caring Professor. You cant go wrong with her!

Dr. Harrison is very passive aggressive. Her instructions are not clear, and she was harsh grading assignments. She also did not provide adequate feedback for failed assignments. For an introductory lab class, she gave the impression that you should already know the class material. And quite honestly, she made me feel ridiculed.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She was so wonderful. She explained things well and took the time to answer students' questions. I loved going to her class and I always learned something new. The textbook is online and that's where she gives homework, but it was easy to understand. If you get the chance to take her, do it!!

Dr. Harrison is super nice and funny. Her class is definitely an easy A. You can tell shes very passionate about biology and she loves to communicate with students. She replies to emails super fast. Her tests all have two attempts and as long as you go over the class powerpoints, you should do well. I really enjoyed this class!
Overall, she was a great professor but was a tough grader and wasn't good at explaining the material. I enjoyed her personality but not her as a teacher.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: Easy A for a lot of people. Little quizzes and super quizzes, each with two attempts. Attendance and participation matters!! A lot of extra credit. If you put in the work its an easy A.

Weekly Mastering assignments, 8 quizzes (1 dropped), 5 super quizzes (1 dropped), 4 written assignments, 3 surveys/reflections, in-class activity grades. Super quizzes are cumulative quizzes that essentially replace having test, 2 attempts on each. They are every other week. Group work during majority of the sessions, groups do not change.

Just take this class. I honestly don't believe anyone could ever fail this class, i'm serious. She gives 2 attempts for every exam and you can easily find them and gives a lot of extra credit. She truly cares about her students and wants you to understand the concept. Plus she brought Baby Yoda to the class : )

Professor Harrison is amazing, and she truly cares for her students. There is a good amount of group work, but it is all in class. If you struggle with testing this a good class for you because there are superquizes every two weeks rather than tests. You get 2 attempts on the superquizes, so you can study what you got wrong on the first attempt.

Great Teacher. Lots of extra credit opportunities. The textbook is not necessarily used in class but can be useful for posters and worksheets. Gives lots of feedback on work. The Final is a poster presentation. Attendance is super important to do well in the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I would say she's mediocre. I'll cut her some slack because it was her first online class with 150 students. I wouldn't have been as successful if it wasn't for my AP Bio background. But a good thing is that she DOES give a lot of extra credit. If you are new to biology, I would definitely recommend someone with a bit more structure.

Just study, show up to the lab, email her for content questions, and you'll be fine. She's nice and friendly when you approach her and open up. Solid lab professor. Would take her again. Gives extra credit. Very clear on what she wants from you.

I had Dr. Harrison for lab, and it was super straightforward. She gives clear lectures regarding the lab material and is willing to answer any questions. I forgot to turn in an assignment, and she let me turn it in 2 weeks later for full credit, so she is super sweet and understanding. Lots of extra credit as well.

She is one of the best professors at KSU. She teaches in a way we all will learn. She give a lot of extra credit. A LOT! She gave us an extra 20 point just for voting in the election. We don't have tests, we have superquizes (basically a test). One quiz or super quiz every week. Mastering HW. Group work. Had her lab, but a TA taught instead.

Dr. Harrison is easily one of my favorite professors at KSU. Her 1107 lecture is easy, just make sure you participate in the group work that she assigns. Mainly just lectures, group powerpoints, and hw. No exams, just super quizzes that cover multiple chapters (lowest is dropped). Regular quizzes are in class with group (lowest two are dropped).
Hardest lab professor I've ever had.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Tough grader
